title: India is reportedly considering another draconian smartphone surveillance plan
description: The nation's telecom industry wants to force smartphone makers to leave devices' location services on at all times, with no way to turn them off.

title: India withdraws pilot restrictions after largest airline cancels flights and disrupts airports
description: India's aviation watchdog temporarily rolled back restrictions on airline crew duty hours, days after the previous order disrupted operations at major Indian airports as the country’s biggest airline, IndiGo, scrambled to restore normal services.  India’s Ministry of Civil Aviation said late Friday the suspension of the new rules would go into effect immediately.  Friday was the fourth straight day of disruptions as the low-cost carrier IndiGo struggled with the rules change.

title: South Africa chase record 359 to beat India
description: South Africa complete the joint highest chase in the history of one-day internationals in India as they passed a target of 359 to win by four wickets in Naya Raipur.

title: JWST discovers an ancient Milky Way-like spiral galaxy
description: A pair of researchers in Pune (India) has identified one of the most surprising galaxies yet uncovered by the James Webb Space Telescope: a fully formed

title: Rohit breaks ODI sixes record as India beat South Africa
description: Rohit Sharma breaks Shahid's Afridi's 15-year record for the most sixes in one-day internationals as India beat South Africa in the opening game of their three-match series.

title: Boeing, Going, Gone: The Forgotten Air India Plane
description: KOLKATA: On November 14, a Boeing 737-200 aircraft that was lying idle at Kolkata airport for over 13 years finally rolled out and headed to Bengaluru.

title: India growth beats all estimates as factories defy Trump tariffs
description: India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi called the GDP number "very encouraging."

title: Invincible no more: Why India's Test cricket reputation lies in ruins
description: India's shocking series defeat to South Africa has left fans anguished and Indian cricket beleaguered.

title: Deepti commands big fee but Healy unsold in WPL
description: India all-rounder Deepti Sharma returns to UP Warriorz for 3.2 Indian crore (approx £272,000), just short of the record 3.4 Indian crore Royal Challengers Bengaluru paid for India opener Smirti Mandhana in 2023.

title: India’s Economic Growth Outlook Muddied by US Trade Deal Woes
description: India’s economy and financial markets are sending conflicting signals about the growth outlook, complicating policymakers’ efforts to support activity as high US tariffs weigh on prospects.

title: India’s Fear Gauge Is Set for Its Biggest Weekly Decline Since May

title: South Africa hammer India by 408 runs to complete historic clean sweep
description: South Africa hand India their heaviest defeat by runs to complete a compelling 2-0 series sweep in Guwahati on Wednesday.

title: India’s Motilal Plans Private Credit Fund of Up To $336 Million
description: India’s Motilal Oswal Alternate Investment Advisors Pvt Ltd. has applied to the Securities and Exchange Board of India to raise as much as 30 billion rupees ($336 million) for its maiden private credit fund.

title: India Becomes One of the World’s Calmest Stock Markets
description: Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:

title: IMF Reclassifies India’s FX Regime as Rupee Turns More Volatile
description: The International Monetary Fund reclassified India’s exchange-rate regime after the rupee moved more freely, and said the nation is well-positioned to allow greater flexibility in its currency.

description: India...

title: A Marriott executive says the hotel chain is betting big on this market
description: John Toomey, Marriott International's chief commercial officer, said India is now at the same position China was at 10 to 15 years ago.

title: England face debutants Italy at 2026 T20 World Cup
description: England will face tournament debutants Italy at the 2026 Men's T20 World Cup while defending champions India and Pakistan will renew their rivalry in the group stage.

title: India Seafood Exporters' Stocks in Focus as Local Shrimp Find Takers in Non-US Markets

title: India’s economy likely grew 7.3% in July–September quarter- Reuters poll
Citi India Nears $1 Billion Book of Asset Backed Securities
description: Citigroup Inc.’s India unit has more than doubled its asset-backed securities book to nearly $1 billion in the last two years, ahead of schedule for a goal it set for itself in February.

title: High Frequency Firms See India Profits Surge Despite Regulatory Curbs
description: High-frequency trading firms have posted strong profit growth in India despite regulatory curbs, showcasing their agility in tapping opportunities across the country’s $5.4 trillion equity market.

title: India face huge task to avoid another home defeat
description: India face an uphill battle if they are to avoid another home Test series defeat after South Africa hit 489 on day two of the second Test in Guwahati.

title: Traders Watch for RBI Presence After Rupee Enters Uncharted Zone
description: India’s rupee may weaken further, according to analysts, who are watching the central bank’s willingness to defend a currency buffeted by the harshest US tariffs in Asia.

title: TPG, Warburg Weigh $500 Million Stake in India-Rooted Sirion
description: TPG Capital LP and Warburg Pincus are in early talks to buy a stake in Sirion Labs Pvt., a Partners Group Holding AG-backed software business managing and automating contracts, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: U.S. chipmaker Marvell plans India hiring spree, R&D push to tap AI boom
description: BENGALURU (Reuters) -U.S. chipmaker Marvell Technology plans to boost hiring and research spending in India to ​tap surging global demand for AI infrastructure, its India head told ‌Reuters.  The company aims to grow its 1,700-strong workforce in India by 15% annually over the ‌next three years, Navin Bishnoi said in an interview on Wednesday, but refrained from giving details of the expanded research and development budget.  India contributes a small portion of Marvell's revenue, but Bishnoi expects that to grow ‍as local data center capacity expands and data protection laws tighten.
